content.description: Start on the right side of the boulder on underclings, and then work your way up to the end of the double arete.
content.protection: Pads, just put them in the right spots
content.location: Upon entering the creek, follow it for about 2-3 minutes and this giant boulder will be in your left. Has some potential for some gnarly slab problems on the side facing the creek (which will most likely be the side you see first when approaching it), but have fun with that.

content.description: Extremely low start on match ledge, move to a left hand crimp lip. Figure out how how to move up and left out of the small cave using a variety of okay but not good at all holds. It’s definitely possible, all the holds are there but the moves are stout.
content.location: After reaching the stegosaurus monolith boulder on the left side of the creek. Keep walking along that ridge line for a few minutes until you see a small cave up on a slightly taller part of the ridge.

content.description: A few boulders problems along Brush Creek.
